title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.7.49 Part 2 | 23-01-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyana Timiran Dhasya Gyanan Janishalakaya
Chakshurun Militam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnu Padaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale
Shri Mate Bhakti Vedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda
Shri Advaita Gadadhara Shiva Sadhi Gaurabhakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
In the previous session I began discussing the 49th verse of the 7th chapter of the 1st canto of Bhagavatam.
I will complete it in this session.
I will read once again the 49th verse just for your refreshing your memory.
Suta Vacha Dharmam Nyayam Sakarunam Nirvyalekam Samam Mahat
The meaning of this verse is Suta Goswami is speaking to the
O Brahamanas, he is telling, he is addressing them and speaking to them.
King Yudhishthira fully supported the statements of the queen.
Which were in accordance with the principles of religion, Dharmam and were justified, Nyayam and were full of mercy, Sakarunam, Nirvyalekam without duplicity.
Samam, full of equity and Mahat, they were glorious.
So, King Yudhishthira fully supported Queen Draupadi's statements which were having all these wonderful characteristics.
So, in the Purport, Srila Prabhupada says that
Maharaja Yudhishthira was a son of Dharmaraja.
So, he knew exactly what are the principles of religion and he supported Draupadi who was justified in telling Arjuna, don't kill Ashwathama even though he is a murderer of the five sons of Draupadi.
That we have discussed earlier that Draupadi was making the statement or telling Arjuna, don't kill Ashwathama because she was conversant with the principles of religion.
Dharma means the eternal principles of our religion.
That is what I mean by Dharmashastra.
It is the intrinsic nature of service.
So, such service has to be guided by the scriptural injunctions.
So, there is Dharmashastra how to conduct ourselves while we are living in this world for maintaining ourselves as well as for ultimate liberation from this material bondage.
